item.title: Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth ‘Moomin 80’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Moomin celebrates 80th anniversary.

Hyper Games has released a new trailer for Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth in celebration of Moomin‘s 80th anniversary.

Here is an overview of the game, via Hyper Games:

About

From the creators of Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley comes a heartwarming new adventure inspired by the beloved Moomin stories by Tove Jansson. This time, join Moomintroll himself on a charming but cold winter journey.

When Moomintroll unexpectedly wakes up early from his winter hibernation, he finds himself completely alone for the first time, in a world he barely recognizes. The familiar landscape of Moominvalley is now cloaked in the frosty veil of the Lady of the Cold. Initially seeking someone to care for him and longing to banish winter, young Moomintroll reluctantly embarks on a journey into the unknown, learning to forge new friendships and help those in greater need than himself.

Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth is a story-driven, cozy puzzle adventure that lets you return to the enchanting Moominvalley through the creative lens of the award-winning indie studio Hyper Games. While not a direct sequel to Snufkin: Melody of Moominvalley, it is a spiritual successor with many similarities. You can enjoy both games on their own, and in any order you’d like.

Key Features

  • Third-Person, Top-Down Adventure – Explore Moominvalley and enjoy the beautiful winter landscape.
  • Story-Driven Exploration – Discover the warmth of winter with Moomintroll.
  • A Winter Wonderland – Inspired by Tove Jansson’s Moominland Midwinter.
  • Play as Moomintroll – Everyone’s favorite Moomin on a quest for warmth and friendship.
  • Environmental Puzzles – Set in beautifully crafted, cozy surroundings.

Moomintroll: Winter’s Warmth is due out for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2026.

Watch the trailer below.

Moomin 80 Trailer

item.title: Inti Creates announces Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Action and strategy hybrid due out on April 23, 2026.

Inti Creates has announced hybrid 2D action and strategy game Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch on April 23, 2026 for $14.99 / 1,980 yen worldwide. Users who buy the Switch version will be able to upgrade to the Switch 2 version via a free “Upgrade Pack.”

In Japan, physical standard and limited editions will be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch. The standard edition will cost 3,850 yen, and the limited edition 9,350 yen. The limited edition includes a full-color art book, a two-disc soundtrack CD, and an acrylic keychain. All physical editions will also include the bonus downloadable content “Gunvolt Character Skin,” and pre-orders include an A4-size original clear file.

Here is an overview of the game, via Inti Creates:

■ About

Kingdom’s Return: Time-Eating Fruit and the Ancient Monster is an action RPG where players must adventure to restore their fallen kingdom. Collect materials in 2D side-scrolling adventure stages, then use them in the strategy part to build your city as you see fit, and powering up your characters in the process!

hoose from one of four characters, Imperial, Alchemist, Wizard, or Zipangu, and set out on adventure through a variety of action stages. Collect the materials here you’ll use to build up your kingdom, placing buildings that buff your characters’ stats. Then set out again to conquer even more dangerous stages, until the bosses are afraid of you!

■ Story

In a world of swords, magic, and fairies, you are a lone adventurer who suddenly becomes tasked to revive the ruined kingdom of Almacia along with the Fairy of Time, Chronos.

Through adventure (action) and revival (strategy), restore the kingdom to its former glory!

■ Playable Characters

Imperial

With high defense, Imperial is your reliable close-range fighter.

Her shield gives her guard abilities that allow her to safely get into range for her sword. Her easy-to-use skills, together with her unique counter action, give her a high maximum damage output.

Alchemist

Alchemist specializes in mixing potions to inflict statuses and other effects on enemies. Change the element of his bottles with a unique action, then inflict the perfect status effect for the situation.

His skills also apply a variety of debuffs, allowing him to consistently weaken his enemies.

Conversely, he has few direct attacks, so he’ll need to focus on status effects while he fights.

Wizard

Wizard fights from long range using a variety of magic attacks.

Her charge action can power up her magic before she casts it. Most of her actions will use SP (skill points), so you’ll need to keep an eye on it.

Her health and defense is low, so positioning is of utmost importance.

Zipangu

Skilled at attacking and dodging, Zipangu’s specialty is consecutive attacks.

He can get in close with a dodge move, then press the attack harder than any other character.

What he wants to do is rather simple: dodge, then attack back. However, his defense is lacking, so failing to dodge will be painful.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here.

Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: EVO 2026 and EVO Japan 2026 title lineups announced
item.content:encoded:
12 games each. No extended lineups.

The Evolution Championship Series has announced the official title lineups for EVO 2026 and EVO Japan 2026. EVO 2026 will run from June 26 to 28 at Las Vegas Convention Center West Hall in Las Vegas, Nevada, and EVO Japan 2026 from May 1 to 3 at Tokyo Big Sight in Tokyo, Japan.

The official title lineups are as follows:

  • EVO 2026
    • 2XKO (first appearance at EVO)
    • BlazBlue: Central Fiction (third appearance at EVO)
    • Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves (second appearance at EVO)
    • Guilty Gear: Strive (fifth appearance at EVO)
    • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising (third appearance at EVO)
    • Invincible VS (first appearance at EVO)
    • Rivals of Aether II (second appearance at EVO)
    • Street Fighter 6 (fourth appearance at EVO)
    • Tekken 8 (third appearance at EVO)
    • Under Night In-Birth II Sys:Celes (third appearance at EVO)
    • Vampire Savior: The Legend of Vampire (first appearance at EVO)
    • Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. World Stage (first appearance at EVO)
  • EVO Japan 2026
    • 2XKO (first appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves (first appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising (third appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Guilty Gear: Strive (fifth appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Hokuto no Ken (first appearance at EVO Japan)
    • The King of Fighters XV (fourth appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Melty Blood: Type Lumina (second appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Street Fighter 6 (third appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Tekken 8 (third appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Under Night In-Birth II Sys:Celes (second appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Vampire Savior: The Legend of Vampire (first appearance at EVO Japan)
    • Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. World Stage (first appearance at EVO Japan)

Registration for EVO 2026 is available now at evo.gg.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/evo-2026-and-evo-japan-2026-title-lineups-announced

item.title: RoadOut launches March 12, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Post-apocalyptic action adventure game dated.

Post-apocalyptic action adventure game RoadOut will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 12, 2026, publisher DANGEN Entertainment and developer Rastrolabs announced. A demo is currently available for Xbox Series until December 31 as part of the Indie Selects Demo Fest.

Here is an overview of the game, via DANGEN Entertainment:

About

RoadOut is a rule-breaking fusion of rotable 2.5 dungeon exploration and retro vehicular mayhem. Players step into the role of Claire, a mercenary for hire who races, fights, hacks, and crashes her way through the ruins of The Dead Zone. In her quest to uncover her connection to A.I., she’ll uncover conspiracies, clash with gangs, track down tech-fantasia relics, and personalize her ride for maximum style and destruction.

Players can look forward to puzzle-filled dungeons with twin-stick combat, overworld exploration on wheels, rock n’ roll style racing, crafting and mods, all wrapped in a post-apocalyptic world seething with retro style and synthwave.

Story

After a great cataclysm, what’s left is a post-apocalyptic world dominated by an A.I. with rebel groups that take refuge in a desert area known as The Dead Zone.

Claire survives in this world by executing black market contracts for local leaders involving delivery, sabotage and murder. The Dead Zone, now not so dead, is occupied by three rival factions: The Wasteheads, The SaibaKuran, and Order of the New Code.

While investigating her past, Claire uncovers strange evidence that links her existence to the origin of the A.I.

Gameplay

Part exploration on-wheels, part dungeon crawler, RoadOut shifts between retro-style behind-the-wheel action and on-foot brawling. Switch from turbo-charged chases to twin-stick shootouts. Drive into run-down city hubs, take on underground side quests, and blow up dangerous hideouts. Players can upgrade both Claire and her ride with body mod and vehicular customization, while scouring the world for items to craft their own items, weapons and upgrades.

Key features

  • Explore the World on Wheels – The world is no longer the same. All that remains is The Dead Zone, a large artificial biome created to sustain a new era of humanity. Drive through The Dead Zone doing jobs, getting paid and running roughshod over the scum guarding the secrets of the world. Join factions, fight rival gangs, barter items and take up quests to earn clout while progressing Claire’s story.
  • Twin Stick Combat and Dungeon Exploration – Exit your ride and explore locations in the world of RoadOut on foot. Crush bandits with short and long range attacks, block with your shield, and recover using drugs that you’ve crafted on the way. Solve puzzles using fully rotatable stack sprite perspectives that look 2D, but are actually 3D.
  • Body Mods and Cybernetics – Craft new moves, weapons and drugs to survive. You can customize Claire with body mods, cybernetics and an intricate skill tree system. Upgrade her car to traverse different terrain and withstand the effects of weather, night and day.
  • Battle in Your Bitchin’ Ride – Equipped with weapons and other tech, Claire’s car is your best friend against dangers in The Dead Zone. Hungry animals are ready to rip you apart. Murderous bandits will rob your lifeless corpse. Prepare for the worst with your car and its arsenal of weapons.
  • Race for Glory – The world may have come to an end, but who said we can’t have fun? Ride or die in red-hot races to be the best on the post apocalyptic circuit. 10 tracks in multiple biomes, innumerable races, all of them equal measures deadly and glorious. Indulge in extra game modes such as destruction derby-style racing and twisted battle arena, all while roading out to a thumping synthwave soundtrack.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/roadout-launches-march-12-2026
